definition: level of mastery (of a skill or area of knowledge)/(archaic) to pay a visit to sb
to make/to build/to manufacture/to invent/to fabricate/to go to/party (in a lawsuit or legal agreement)/crop/classifier for crops
to go (to visit a superior)/one's current attainment in learning or art

sentences.english: Appreciation of your high talents and literary attainments.
sentences.chinese: 對你的出衆才華和文學造詣的賞識。

sentences.english: Sudongpo believed in Buddism and he was possessed of great attainments in it.
sentences.chinese: 蘇東坡信仰佛教，對佛學頗有造詣。

sentences.english: Each of the previous techniques goes a long way toward preventing accidental damage.
sentences.chinese: 之前介紹的每項技術都在阻止意外破壞方面造詣頗深。

sentences.english: Being a very famous Confucianist, Huang Zongxi also had indepth understanding in medicine.
sentences.chinese: 黃宗羲乃曠世之名儒，對醫學也造詣頗高。

sentences.english: Lhabu has made important achievements in Buddhist studies, and enjoys great popularity amongst other monks and lamas.
sentences.chinese: 拉布有較高的佛學造詣，在廣大僧衆中有很高的威信。

sentences.english: Tao Yuanming's posies show very unique style and great and high attainments in citation.
sentences.chinese: 陶淵明詩文創作在藝術上具有獨特風格和極高的造詣。

sentences.english: Do not be afraid of the loneliness of enlightenment.
sentences.chinese: 不要害怕因造詣深而產生的孤獨感。

sentences.english: The sixth chapter "the Yuan Can Article States Discusses": Analyzes Yuan Can's write Style and doctrine attainments in Buddhist.
sentences.chinese: 分析袁粲嬉笑怒罵的文風及其在佛法中的造詣。

sentences.english: Sometimes even of the artist in contemporary artistic attainments.
sentences.chinese: 對藝術家有時候甚至影響在當代藝術上的造詣。

sentences.english: He's very knowledgeable about the Chinese classics.
sentences.chinese: 他對中國古典作品造詣很深。

sentences.english: Jiang Kui who has the original attainments in the poetry creation aspect is also well-known by Ci.
sentences.chinese: 以詞聞名的姜夔在詩歌創作方面也有獨到的造詣。

sentences.english: His best field was figure painting.
Then it, poetry and painting them in both high attainments .
sentences.chinese: 然後呢，她們在詩詞和繪畫方面都有很高的造詣。

sentences.english: and you have to listen to other accomplished flute-players.
sentences.chinese: 而且必須聆聽，其他有造詣的長笛手的表演。

sentences.english: We all envy him his linguistic attainments.
sentences.chinese: 我們都羨慕他在語言方面的造詣。

sentences.english: Secondly, you compliment me by saying I’m an accomplished public speaker.
sentences.chinese: 其次，你誇獎我是一位很有造詣的演說家。

definition: to make a contribution/to establish/to found/contribution
to skim (through a book)/to read cursorily/to dip into
lit. the stove fire has turned bright green (allusion to Daoist alchemy) (idiom)/fig. (of an art, a technique etc) brought to the point of perfection
scholarship/high-level study/to do scholarly research/to pursue a high level of study
